result.execSummary:
The defendant Mikaela A Dahnert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -- to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 as recommended per agent 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1 time per month for the first 3 months and then at the discretion of the agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee

The Court grants Ms. Dahnert expungement upon successful completion of Probation.

records.addlTxt: Two statements
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CM488 and 15CM36 called together at 2:00pm [mo]
Defendant Mikaela A Dahnert in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM36; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3 of Case #15CM36 and Case #14CM488.
DA Happ files a Victim Impact Statement for Case #15CM36
--the Court reviews Statement

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Huebner 

On Counts #1 and #2 of Case 15CM36, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
 as recommended per agent 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening (at least 1 time per month for the first 3 months and then at the discretion of the agent)
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with any known drug offenders except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate by agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand to designee
--On Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--On Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court grants Ms. Dahnert expungement upon successful completion of Probation. 


Days credit for time already served:  0 days
recess: 2:20pm
Scheduling order
Jury trial on May 18/19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on May 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CM488 & 15CM36 called together at 1:42 pm [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Mikaela A Dahnert in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Huebner informs the Court that agreements have not yet been reached; requests matters be set for trial
Counsel agree each case will need 1 day for trial and that they should not be tried together
DA Happ requests the 15CM36 case be heard first as charges are more serious and have the 14CM488 case set for STC at same time as FSSC. Do have proposed global resolution
Atty Huebner agrees as disposition in 15CM36 may have effect on 14CM488
Court confirms address on file is accurate for Ms. Dahnert and that her bond remains in effect
Parties agree that trial can be set on 2-day setting although only 1 day is needed, otherwise dates would be set out mid-June or later
Recess: 1:47 pm 

NEXT: 14CM488 - (1) Schedule STC 5/12/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices
15CM36 - (1) Schedule FSSC 5/12/15 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 5/18-19/15 at 8:30 am
Status conference on March 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2015 at 01:40 pm.
Scheduling notice

Reserve Judge Hassin presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #14CM488 and #15CM36 called at 9:44am. [MK]
Defendant Mikaela A Dahnert in court with Attorney Karl Huebner.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived.
In both cases:  Pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defense
recess
 9:46am.


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 3/4/15 at 1:40pm  (2)  Status Conference on both cases on 3/13/15 at 1:30pm.
Attorney Huebner
Adjourned initial appearance on February 20, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Reserve Judge O'Brien presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #14CM488 and #15CM36 called at 11:40m. [MK]
Defendant Mikaela Dahnert in court.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Right to counsel given. Ms. Dahnert indicates that she has applied for PD representation, and the PD is appointing counsel for her. 
The Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $500  signature bond in each case, with conditions: 
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of any prescription drugs without a valid prescription
--no possession of any drug paraphernalia 
--no possession of any needles without a specific prescription from the doctor
--in Case #case #15CM36 only: no discussion of the facts of the case with Lori Becker, Kerry Dahnert, or Dayna Roberts
--in Case #14CM488: no discussion of the facts of the case with Javier Perez
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.

recess  11:36am 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 2/20/15 at 9:30am.
